abstract.text: Queries and reevaluates the currently focused item.

inlineContent.text: object to obtain the focus-related state for the objects of your app. You can get state information for your app’s views, view controllers, windows, and other objects that adopt the

object lists the currently focused item, if any, for a window or view hierarchy. You can use it to force the system to update the focus state, and you can register custom sounds to be played during focus changes.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
A set of methods that define the focus behavior for a branch of the view hierarchy.
The importance of an item within a focus group, used by the focus system to determine the group’s primary item.
An object that can become focused.
The container responsible for providing geometric context to focus items within a given focus environment.
A type of focus item container that supports automatic scrolling of focusable content.
Provides movement hint information for the focused item.
Queries and reevaluates the currently focused item.
Updates the animation coordinator.
The focus for the UI has been updated.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether one focus environment is contained by another.
Retrieves the focus system for the specified environment.
Updates the context key.
The item that’s currently focused.
Retrieves a focus system object that contains the state information for the specified object.
The focus failed to move to another item.
Registers the specified sound file with the focus engine.
Submits a request to update the focus state of the specified object.
Forces the system to act on a pending focus update for the current environment.
An object that provides information relevant to a specific focus update from one view to another.
Design and implement intuitive control schemes for menus and interactive user interface layouts.

abstract.text: Create intuitive and easily manipulated user-interactive controls for your tvOS app.

abstract.text: Navigate between user interface elements using a keyboard and focusable UI elements in iPad apps and apps built with Mac Catalyst.

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
